Name: Statuette of a pilot
Description: The statuette represents a striding man with his left leg advanced. He wears a short garment and a wig covering his ears and tied by a chaplet with a bend at the back. The body is painted red, the whites, the chaplet and the garment are white, the wig, brows, eyelids and pupils are black. The pegged arms are lost. This may be a statuette of a pilot standing on a prow of a model ritual boat.
